pullRequest.title: [Enhancement] Add multiple results per Submission
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.

Motivation and Context
There is currently no supported way to allow for a second correction, see #2015. As a first step towards this goal, this PR aims to change the relation between the Submission and Result from:

to:

Note: This PR only includes server changes.
Description


Change relation between Submission and Result from @OnetoOne to @OneToMany.


Add results_order column to Result to track the order of the results. Because of this change we also had to follow the save procedure described in https://artemis-platform.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev/guidelines/database/#ordered

Add 0 to all existing results in their results_order column for backwards compatibility



Perform the necessary code changes across the application to support the new relation


Add custom serialization and deserialization tag for Jackson to serialize to a single result (latestResult) for the client, and to multiple results for the server. This is a temporary solution until we also change the relationship on the client.


Steps for Testing
There are no functional changes. The goal is to have everything working as usual. Therefore, we must test every aspect of the application that was affected by these changes. These include:


Creating Text-, Modeling-, File Upload-, Quiz-, and Programming Exercises

Add Example Submission with solution for modeling exercises only! (for text exercises there is a bug unrelated to this PR)



Creating Exam

With all exercise types



Participating in Text-, Modeling-, File Upload-, Quiz-, and Programming Exercises

Configure automatic programming assessment



Participating in Exam


Conducting a Test Run

Participate



Assessing Text-, Modeling-, File Upload-, Quiz-, and Programming Exercises

Locking
Overriding
Submitting
Also for exam exercises



Complaining about the Assessment

Complaint
More Feedback Request



Reviewing Complaint

Accepting Complaint
Rejecting Complaint



Test Coverage
There are no changes on the test coverage.
